bug.short_desc: split context dependencies into separate bundle from o.e.m.wikitext.tasks.ui

long_desc.thetext:
To enable integrators to consume the WikiText task editor integration without pulling the Task-focused Interface the o.e.m.wikitext.tasks.ui bundle should be split up. Classes that dependend on these bundles should be moved to a separate bundle (e.g. o.e.m.wikitext.context.ui):
org.eclipse.mylyn.context.core org.eclipse.mylyn.context.ui
As part of that an additional feature that has the task related bundles only should be considered.
+1 sounds like a good change to me.

Any suggestions what makes the most sense in terms of features? Should we create an o.e.my.wikitext.tasks feature that has all bundles that are now in o.e.m.wikitext_feature? The latter would then include the new feature and add the context bundles. Shawn, would that be sufficient for your needs?

merged https://git.eclipse.org/r/11688
As far as features, does it make sense to expose this choice to the user? I'd like to avoid making feature selection overly complicated. The only use case that I can think of is users who don't want tasks but want WikiText. Given that most (all?) EPP distributions come with both WikiText and Tasks, is it worth doing this? If we feel strongly that it should be split into a separate feature then perhaps we should leave one of those two features uncategorized so that they don't both show up in the UI by default.
Agreed. The feature would be mostly targeted at integrators. If there is no need for it I'm fine with leaving the split as is.
